BiocProject - PEP for biological applications

Michal Stolarczyk

2018-10-09

BiocProject_intro.Rmd

Load libraries and create an empty BiocProject object

library(BiocProject)
bp=BiocProject()
bp
## An object of class "BiocProject"
## Slot "metadata":
## list()

Get project config file path

projectConfig = system.file(
"extdata",
"example_peps-master",
"example_basic",
"project_config.yaml",
package = "pepr"
)

Create a BiocProject object with Portable Encapsulated Project (PEP) loaded to the the metadata slot as an object of Project class

bp = BiocProject(file = projectConfig)
## Loaded config file:  
## /Library/Frameworks/R.framework/Versions/3.5/Resources/library/pepr/extdata/example_peps-master/example_basic/project_config.yaml
## Loading required namespace: data.table
bp
## An object of class "BiocProject"
## Slot "metadata":
## $PEP
## PEP project object. Class:  Project
##   file:  
## /Library/Frameworks/R.framework/Versions/3.5/Resources/library/pepr/extdata/example_peps-master/example_basic/project_config.yaml
##   samples:  2

Use the accessor methods to inspect the object:

samples(bp)
##    sample_name       library                file
## 1:      frog_1 anySampleType data/frog1_data.txt
## 2:      frog_2 anySampleType data/frog2_data.txt
config(bp)
## PEP project object. Class: Config
##  metadata:
##     sample_annotation: 
## /Library/Frameworks/R.framework/Versions/3.5/Resources/library/pepr/extdata/example_peps-master/example_basic/sample_annotation.csv
##     output_dir: /Users/mstolarczyk/hello_looper_results
##  name: example_basic

Get the sample project config for samples subannotation functionality presentation

projectConfig = system.file(
"extdata",
"example_peps-master",
"example_subannotation1",
"project_config.yaml",
package = "pepr"
)

Create a BiocProject object:

bp = BiocProject(file = projectConfig)
## Loaded config file:  
## /Library/Frameworks/R.framework/Versions/3.5/Resources/library/pepr/extdata/example_peps-master/example_subannotation1/project_config.yaml
bp
## An object of class "BiocProject"
## Slot "metadata":
## $PEP
## PEP project object. Class:  Project
##   file:  
## /Library/Frameworks/R.framework/Versions/3.5/Resources/library/pepr/extdata/example_peps-master/example_subannotation1/project_config.yaml
##   samples:  3

Get the desired subsample:

getSubsample(bp,"frog_1","sub_a")
##    sample_name       library                 file subsample_name
## 1:      frog_1 anySampleType data/frog1a_data.txt          sub_a

Get the sample project config for samples subproject functionality presentation

projectConfig = system.file(
"extdata",
"example_peps-master",
"example_subprojects2",
"project_config.yaml",
package = "pepr"
)

Create a BiocProject object:

bp = BiocProject(file = projectConfig)
## Loaded config file:  
## /Library/Frameworks/R.framework/Versions/3.5/Resources/library/pepr/extdata/example_peps-master/example_subprojects2/project_config.yaml
##   subprojects:  noFrog
bp
## An object of class "BiocProject"
## Slot "metadata":
## $PEP
## PEP project object. Class:  Project
##   file:  
## /Library/Frameworks/R.framework/Versions/3.5/Resources/library/pepr/extdata/example_peps-master/example_subprojects2/project_config.yaml
##   samples:  6
##   subprojects:  noFrog

Find out what subprojects are available:

pepr::listSubprojects(config(bp))
##   subprojects:  noFrog

Activate the desired subproject and view the samples:

subBp = BiocProject(file = projectConfig, subproject = "noFrog")
## Loaded config file:  
## /Library/Frameworks/R.framework/Versions/3.5/Resources/library/pepr/extdata/example_peps-master/example_subprojects2/project_config.yaml
##   subprojects:  noFrog
## Loading subproject:  noFrog
samples(subBp)
##    sample_name organism time                       file_path genome
## 1:    human_1h    human    1 data/lab/project/human_1h.fastq   hg38
## 2:    human_0h    human    0 data/lab/project/human_0h.fastq   hg38
## 3:    mouse_1h    mouse    1 data/lab/project/mouse_1h.fastq   mm10
## 4:    mouse_0h    mouse    0 data/lab/project/mouse_1h.fastq   mm10
##    macs_genome_size
## 1:               hs
## 2:               hs
## 3:               mm
## 4:               mm
